info: Use to inform that  an initial part of the request has been received and the client should proceed with the request or ignore the response.
Use to inform that the server understands the `Upgrade` header field request and indicates which protocol it is switching to.
Use to inform that the server has accepted the full request but has not yet completed it and no response is available as of yet.
Use to allow the user agent to preload resources, while we prepare a response. It is intended to be primarily used with the Link Header.
Use to inform that the request was successful.
Use to inform that the request was successful and resulted in one or more resources being created.
Use to inform that the request has been accepted for processing but the may or may not be completed when the processing finishes.

Use to inform that the request was successful. However, the meta-information that has been received is different from the one on the origin server. When not used for backups or mirrors of another resource a '200' OK response is preferable.
Use to inform that the request was successfully fulfilled the request, and there is no available content for this request.
Use to inform that the user should reset the document that sent this request.
Use in response to a `Range` header sent from the client that's requesting only a part of the resource.
Use to convey information about multiple resources when multiple status codes are appropriate.
Use inside the response element 'DAV: _propstat_', in order to avoid enumerating the internal members of multiple bindings to the same collection repeatedly.
Use to inform that the server has successfully fulfilled a `GET` request, and the response is a representation of the result of one or multiple instance-manipulations applied to the current instance.
